            EXCEPT SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA),BBFAO-BB FAO,TF040956-HONDURAS: LAND AMINISTRATION,TF038772-NICARAGUA - PREPARATION OF LAND
            ADMINISTRATION PROJECT,TF096270-Gender focus in the Nicaragua
            Access to Land,TF093190-SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY BASED
            TOURISM DEVELOPMENT FOR THE CARIBBEAN COAST,TF025367-PHRD-LAND MANAGEMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Land Administration Project of
            Nicaragua is intended to improve the security of land
            tenure, obtaining by this means: i) To promote investment in
            agriculture, leading to productivity growth and income; ii)
            To contribute to social justice by focusing on the most
            vulnerable groups (small farmers and indigenous peoples);
            iii) To promote sustainable use of natural resources; and
            iv) To increase tax collection at the municipal level, as a
            way of promoting decentralized service delivery. Internally
            the Project Appraisal Document is to file a return with some
            variations for the purpose of long-term development of the
            project, consisting of four parts: a) Develop and establish
            a legal, institutional, technical and national policy
            framework to support the routine administration of property
            rights that is efficient, reliable and equitable; b)
            Develop, implement and validate a systematic methodology,
            accelerate and improve processing requests for new titles
            and revised titles in three departments so that these can be
            applied subsequently to the national level and eliminate the
            lag in the application title; c) Achieve substantial
            progress in the recognition and definition of the rights of
            lands of indigenous peoples and territories and to demarcate
            communal lands; and d)Achieve substantial progress in the
            definition and demarcation of the existing areas and
            proposed protected as well as critical habitat.

BBFAO-BB FAO,TF025367-PHRD-LAND MANAGEMENT PROJECT,TF030314-DANISH CTF GENERAL FY03 - (ALL
            EXCEPT SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA),TF038772-NICARAGUA - PREPARATION OF LAND
            ADMINISTRATION PROJECT,TF040956-HONDURAS: LAND AMINISTRATION,TF093190-SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITY BASED
            TOURISM DEVELOPMENT FOR THE CARIBBEAN COAST,TF096270-Gender focus in the Nicaragua
            Access to Land

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Land Administration
            Project for Nicaragua were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            the sustainability of outcomes of land administration
            interventions requires building broad social and political
            commitment, as well as maintaining and mainstreaming key
            competencies across electoral cycles. The complexity of
            recognizing indigenous people's land rights requires
            attention to historical and social particularities and
            intensive social supervision. Improving a land
            administration system involves gradual changes in the legal
            and institutional frameworks. A strong focus on
            municipalities is critical to the sustainability of
            investments on cadaster and registry modernization in
            Nicaragua. Alternative conflict resolution (ACR) mechanisms
            can effectively facilitate cadastral and regularization processes.
